column4: how can i re-run 10.10 server setup to get back into network setup. iwconfig isn't installed and i need it to connect to a wireless network
hmm
hmm
how can i auto-detect wireless config?
all i see is loopback in /etc/network/interfaces
it seems as if it is in the server setup under manual package selection according to this forum post
but how can i get back into the package selection after i have already installed ubuntu server
iwconfig isnt installed on ubuntu server by default
it looks like i need to select it
how can i get back into the server setup?
you don't need to go into the server setup to install something
off the cd?
just do sudo apt-get install packageyouwanttoinstall
will that install it locally?
or go out to the net to install it?
yes
it depends on your /etc/apt/sources.list file
yeah, right now i cant get to the net to install it
how can i tell aptitude to search the cd
i have the cd in the drive
find / -name wireless-tools
then it will find the package you need
then go to the folder and do sudo dpkg -i wireless-tools
